root.DebateTimingRubric: Business Question to the Leader of the House
Select Committee Statement on the Third Special Report of the Education Committee, Ofsted’s work with schools: Government’s Response to the Committee’s First Report, HC 689

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That this House has considered the importance of Lesbian Visibility Week; and believes LGBTQIA women and non-binary people should be recognised for the work they do and the joy they bring.

from_cdata.span: has considered the recommendations of the Buckland Review into Autism and Employment; and urges the Government,

from_cdata.span: and the wider economy to implement them.

from_cdata.p: The subjects for these debates were determined by the Backbench Business Committee.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 5.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Tackling the use of single-use plastics: Sarah Dyke
root.DebateTimingRubric: The sitting will last for up to three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
root.MotionText: That this House has considered health inequalities in liver disease and liver cancer: Navendu Mishra
That this House has considered the ratification of the Global Ocean Treaty: Kevin Foster

from_cdata.p: The subjects for these debates were determined by the Backbench Business Committee. These debates will begin at 12.30pm and 2.00pm (Order of 25 March on Westminster Hall: Sitting Times). The sitting will be suspended and time added if divisions take place in the main Chamber (Standing Order No. 10(3)).
